meanings.sent1: The radicel of the plant absorbed water from the soil.
meanings.sent2: The gardener carefully examined the radicel of the seedling.
meanings.sent3: The radicel decided to take a break and grow sideways for a change.
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity was a radicel, branching out to explore new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The radicel, like a tiny explorer, ventured into the unknown depths of the earth.

meanings.definition: A small branch or division of a nerve or vein.
meanings.sent1: The doctor pointed to the radicel in the diagram of the nervous system.
meanings.sent2: The radicel carried nutrients to the smallest parts of the body.
meanings.sent3: The radicel nervously twitched, unsure of which way to go.
meanings.sent4: His kindness was like a radicel, spreading warmth to every corner of the community.
meanings.sent5: The radicel of friendship connected them in a bond that could not be broken.

meanings.sent1: The radicel of the plant was just starting to grow beneath the surface.
meanings.sent2: The radicel was delicate and easily damaged during transplantation.
meanings.sent3: The radicel playfully wiggled as it searched for nutrients in the soil.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a radicel, slowly but steadily pushing through obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The radicel, like a young sprout, reached out tentatively into the unknown soil.
